review: Ok, I understand that this place just opened so I'll excuse the 45 minute wait to be seated. What I can't have patience for is a one hour wait to receive our food. That's not all, anytime I would ask for a refill or more appetizers and even napkins, it would take them at least 20 minutes for them to either come back with what I asked or to ask me to confirm what it is I asked for initially. This meant an extra 5-10 minute wait.  Summary: super slow service. I was in the restaurant for almost 3 hours of which 2 1/2 hours was spent waiting. I will come again in one month or so to post an updated review, since I understand it was a new restaurant, waiters were new, and it was very busy. It was a bit pricey, but agreeable overall. Hopefully my next visit will change my review.

I think this is the best Fridays I've been to. The staff if so friendly and attentive. My waitress was very enthusiastic and was probably the best waitress I have ever had. The food was amazing and the decor and designs at this Fridays is awesome!! I will definitely come here any time I want to go to Fridays! I also love that when they sing happy birthday to a customer EVERYONE of the staff is involved and they make it fun for the birthday boy/girl! I will be back!!

The food was good, but that was about it. The service was sub par despite having two waitresses attending us. A friend for example waited one hour before receiving  his appetizer, while another friend waited half and hour getting a refill. What this restaurant needs is consistency.

This is a brand new location out here in sunny South Gate, CA!!  Because the location is new everything is very nice.  The interior has brand new everything and the bar is a decent size with a great selection of beers and drinks.   Beware that if you are coming for the unlimited appetizer promotion you will not be allowed to share appetizers.  There was a couple sitting next to me and a waitress took away the fully loaded potato wedge from a woman because her boyfriend had ordered the food an not her.  Don't know why the waiters/waitresses have to be so strict, but they might get in trouble so it is understandable.   Everyone at this location looks like they are learning so please be patient.  We were helped out by Max and he provided great customer service.  I can see this place getting better as time goes by.

I made a yelp account specifically for this review. I came for my first time ever Saturday (technically Sunday)at around 12:40am, by 1:00a.m. me and my friends had ordered our food and drinks we then moved from the bar to one of the surrounding tables. When the bleached-blonde, tattoo covered bartender came to our table asking us is we wanted to close out our bill. I didn't want to but she said that it was something they needed to do since we switched from the bar to the diner. So we told her that it was going to be two separate bills and that if we could get it split.  She said no problem and ,this is where we messed up, we gave her our cards without ever seeing the bill. A little less than 25 minutes later and we are all ready to leave, and that's when I remember we never got our cards back. So we try to get the attention of the bar tender but that didn't work so I get up to go ask for our debit cards back. To which she replies that she transferred our bill to a server named Nelly , someone we never saw and says she will tell her we are ready to leave. We continue to wait and at this point it had already been 15 minutes since we had told the blonde bartender about our dilemma. It's then that we decide to go up and ask someone to see what the hell was going on. We go up by the host stand and wait for someone to come by ,so by the time the manager came out we were frustrated and just asked where our cards were. The manager was confused so we tell her our story and finds it a little weird so she goes to the back to figure out what had happened. When she comes out she ends up telling us that the server (again somebody we never saw) lost one of the cards. I was in disbelief when I heard this.  I have heard about shitty service before but never had I heard about someone losing their debit/credit card because their anonymous server had lost track of it. This is the worst experience ever! The blonde bartender,had a bossy attitude and just kept rushing us. I didn't like her but she got our orders pretty fast, so I didn't mind. The atmosphere there is really nice! I was once again surprised to see such a nice place in South Gate. Not only that but Marty the bartender was awesome. He greeted us personally and poured my drink in a nice mason jar. He also did really great tricks, I really liked him. As much as I was enjoying myself, I will never come back. FYI: There are at least 10 reviews with 2 stars or less that have been filtered under "not recommended" Check them out because this is not a well ran establishment you will be severely disappointed if you.

It has to be the best TGIF I ever been to.. They really take customer service to the next level! So we came on a Sunday afternoon, we waited approximately 30 minutes to be seated, we order an appetizer that took forever to come and when it finally arrived it was wrong but out waiter took care if it right away. Our food also took forever and my order was also wrong:( I just continue eating it because at this point I was really hungry but I made sure to informed our waiter, he right away apologized and send the manager who came to personally apologized and removed my entree from our bill plus my appetizer!! I guess it started with a ugly beginning but a happy ending, I will come back again soon!!

This is my second time here and I have to say I was disappointed once again. I recently found or that this location is a franchise so they are not run by TGIF's but by an independent owner who makes up his/her own rules. The sign on the door said $12 bucket of Coronas and they didn't honor it cuz they said it's after 10pm when the sign clearly doesn't state that. Anyway, the service is slow and many employees are learning on the job. You need patience for sure. And I heard all the negative Yelps have been hidden. We actually left cuz it took an hour to get our appetizers and dinner :( P.S. They hired some shitty servers that I've seen at other restaurants near by so no hope for improvement anytime soon.  We're not coming again!!!
Good service food was on point . No problem on the food wait . I had a sirloin medium rare cooked to perfection .

I only put one star because I had to in order to write a review, it would be zero if I could. I came here with my boyfriend not to long ago and we ordered the two for twenty-five. After we finished out meal, our waiter informed us that he had forgotten to give us our appetizer so they made us wait while the cooked it up. As we waited my boyfriend went to the bar to get a drink and his glass had RED LIPSTICK STILL ON IT!! All they did was apologize and get him another glass. They still freaking charged him. Horrible service. They should've hired trained employees when opening at this new location.
These guys are filtering bad reviews. Scroll to the bottom of the review page and click on "reviews not recommend"  This particular T.G.I.F is FN terrible
TERRIBLE. scroll all the way down to "reviews that are not currently recommended".  THEY HIDE THE TRUE REVIEWS.

I went here with my mom and two small children. There was plenty of tables open buy they had me waiting just to tell me they didn't have enough booster seats for my babies. My kids were standing around our booth. Very uncomfortable!!! I maybe saw 3 small children at the same time we were there. Really who doesn't have boosters seats, even McDonald's has them. Service is close to none. Everyone is very new and trying way too hard to have great customer service. But no one os buying it. I wouldn't go back even of I was invited back. Way to uncomfortable to seat around for another dinner.

Extremely annoying wait times and bad service, waited half hour to get one beer and when it was brought to me it was the wrong one. Not sure how you confuse a Sam Adams with a guiness. On top of that it took another half hour to bring me the correct beer. That's that I Didn't even end up buying food.

I'm gave them a 1 star because I have to...Or else they'd get none. Took an hour and a half to get drinks, never saw food. Plus, waitress brought some of our drinks and didn't know what drinks they were. Just set them down and said "sorry, I don't drink." Plus, the other waiter had no clue what a Pabst was. Terrible service, terrible staffing, terrible management, and an insult to hospitality. Do not recommend!

Have been waiting 15 for a waiter to come to our table after an additional 5 more minutes we decided enough! Fully staffed employees passing us bye looking lost. I was really looking forward to making this one our location,spoke to the lady that sat us and she was very apologetic. Leo the manager came and talked to us he was also very sorry for our experience wanted us to come back and make it right, he promised to make changes and I said I would come back to give it a second chance. So for now 2 stars and I'm hoping to change it to five stars!

Horrible first time experience. I like to think of myself as a person who is always out and about trying new restaurants and with a lot patients. Decided to try this TGI Friday's for the first time, when I got in wasn't greeted and had to walk up to the hostesses to aka for a table. She said it was a 20 min wait so I asked if I could sit outside their not being anyone out there she proceeded to tell me that I Still needed to wait the 20 minutes like everyone else who was waiting to eating inside.... Waitress came 15 minutes after being seated, Took our drink orders came back with them 10 to 15 minutes later, Took our food order and waited in half an hour and our appetizer still hadn't came to us with the table next to us had already received their entire food. Waited 15 more minutes before I decided to get up and walk away. will not be returning to this "TJ Fridays" again... Highly do not recommend it here.

Visited TGI Friday's during their grand opening week, horrible service. I excused it because our server was young and inexperienced. On Saturday, a few friends and I decided to give it another shot and I am glad we did. Briana waited on us by the bar. She did a phenomenal job. She was very friendly and checked on us frequently. She just made our visit a very pleasant experience overall. I work in the service industry and I like to commend people when they go above and beyond and Briana definitely needs to be recognized.

The food was really good and everyone was very friendly. My only complaint is that the people bringing the food out need to learn their take numbers a bit better...3 times the same lady came to our table with different food asking if it was ours. Then apparently the table next to us ordered the same dessert as us...15 minutes After we had ordered and she gave ours to them after going up and down tables (except ours) asking who had ordered it. Then the person who had their dessert later came out and was extremely confused as to why they already had a dessert. We ended up having to flag her down and claim it before it vanished and we just got nothing.

I'm just want to start off by saying that I don't get the bad reviews. I went there yesterday and I thought it was one of the better places I've been to in quite some time. The only problem I had was that I ordered a drink and it took a while to get out of the kitchen but our server Seana was so nice I didn't even care. Definately going to go back.
I really loved this place, the food was great and I had the best waiter ever. So if you go to TGIF at night ask for Shanna shes the best !

It's new and the decor is modern. It's got a really nice outside patio for hanging out Drinking with friends. I ordered the black bean burger and it was delicious. Sadly everything we ordered seemed frozen. The appetizer mozzarella sticks, the kids pizzas, my husbands chicken plate....all frozen. While I'm not the senior authority on frozen foods, we did ask the waitress and she confirmed.  Staff was friendly, attentive and other than the fact that it's mostly frozen it was a nice time

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: This is a review based mainly off of service. I came here the other night with my bf and our waitress was a girl named Alyssa. Turned out she use to work with my bf. Unfortunately her service was terrible. she didn't seem to know much about the menu and left us waiting for a while to order while she tended to other people that came in after us. I overheard the people next to us nicely telling her that their order was not correct when they got their food and rather than turning around to tend to us, she turned around to tell us that those other people were evil for complaining. My bf had to yell out her name as she walked past us just so he could order a drink. Not that it wasnt expected but our order came out ass backwards too. he got the jack daniels glaze on his steak that he didn't order and i didn't get it when i was the one that specifically told her i wanted the glaze on my steak when she offered to give me a side of it. she later on came back to our table to complain that the kitchen was messing up everyone's orders and my bf had to try to squeeze in another order of our endless appetizers in between her complaining. she was fortunate that my bf's a nice guy and still tipped her generously for her terrible service. completely unprofessional waitress, i dunno how she even got the job, maybe the pretty face.

Worst service ever!!!!!!! Never again, came with a few friends after a kings game and I mean honestly I have no words to describe the service here. To top it off, managers are the reason this place suxs.....

I have never been to a tgi Fridays prior to this visit, this particular restaurant had OK quality.  Me and a group of colleagues went there to celebrate a friends bday on a Monday (of all days) and for some reason everyone wanted to get the boy wasted.  I was the only one who got an actual meal (American cheeseburger), it was too greasy and not so delicious in my opinion.   The waitress was friendly.  This establishment is a average nothing spectacular.

IN THERE IS NOT ALWAYS FRIDAY'S Nor will they see me any other day of the week. Terrible first time visit. The waiter kept interrupting our ordering process, by talking about promotions,apps, blah blah blah, I had to actually shut him up to give him  my order. We ordered two ice teas, "Let me get those for you" he said Tic Toc Tic Toc Tic Toc zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz 10 Minutes later he shows up with ONE ice tea. "Oh I am sorry, let me go get you that" Tic Toc Tic Toc Tic Toc zzzzzzzzzzzzzzz Shows up about 10 minutes later. We held him long enough to placed our food order, he wrote everything on some kind of pad. Off he went    (while this was going on, what looked like the floor manager in charge, was too busy admiring the strategically placed tattoo of one of the patrons. OK TIME TO PULL UP THE IPHONE AND GALAXY AND START CHECKING FACEBOOK STATUS. I was keeping my eye on this particular waiter, and he seemed lost, confused and overwhelmed. Here he comes with my friends plate (about 35 Minutes, and yes he came with my friends PLATE!  WTF? is my food!!! Oh I am sorry he said, those should had come together.   (No Sh*t) Off we went for the other plate. Tic Toc Tic Toc 25 MINUTES later he comes to our table and tells me they did not have the cut of meat I ordered and that someone had to go get some, HUH!!!! At this point I was pissed and I asked him nicely to SCRATCH the dam order, at this point my friend had finished his plate (some shrimp chicken stuff) I asked him nicely to start without me. I went next door to Panda Express and got my grub in 7 Minutes. So to summarize, I will never go there again, nor would I recommend the place to anyone.  Educate your waters in customer service and find some new manager that would do more than to pick up chicks in the restaurant.

WOW! I Had never experienced such sloooooww service. My friend and I went for lunch today. Sat in the bar area, guy at the bar helped us out. Everything started off good. We ordered our drinks, he brought them and asked if we needed some time. I nicely replied "only a few minutes" WELL A FEW minutes turned into 25+ min. I finally had to catch a waitress attention and ask her if anyone was going to help us out. she replied "who helped you? They should be right with you" UH broad, had they been tending to us I wouldn't have called you. Anyway, while the guy paced up and down the bar area (no he wasn't busy), a random female comes and takes our order. And again the wait begins. 28 minutes to be exact! Finally, the appetizer arrives (cold) followed by our food. Why did we stay? Because I was hungry and had school right after! I hope their GENERAL MANAGER reads yelp reviews and takes into consideration that most of us complain about the same thing! Speed of Service and Friendliness will make customers return, something this location lacks from severely!

Great location! It's next to In-N-Out and Walmart. Waitress was very attentive and nice, when we got seated our greeter was great and funny! We ordered our drinks and within minutes our drinks were brought! After reading most of these reviews km surprised that they've received not so great service, on the contrary I received great service! Better than other TGIF's I've been in the past. Coming back again :)!

Lively atmosphere but this was the second visit where my food was not brought out....they just forgot....no discount was even offered....person helping me wanted to know if I still wanted my wings 30 mins later...I had to remind her....wont be going back I'd rather spend more money and get better service some where else....I understand this is a new location but no excuse for bad service....all I got where...thats sucks im sorry....unacceptable

This review is based on the service of Jennifer.   When we got there, the hostess told us that there would be an hour wait; so we were on yelp trying to look for nearby restaurants and saw the bad reviews this location had.  It was late, and we didn't feel like going anywhere else.  Since we saw people had left and a lot of people being called weren't there, we asked the hostess if the wait time had changed and it had to 20 minutes.   Based on the Yelp reviews and the attitude of the girls calling people's name, we were expecting bad service.  We were pleasantly surprised when Jennifer was soo amazing.  She was super nice, patient, and attentive.  She answered all our questions and service was reasonably fast.

This place is so nice! I was a  first timer! Cesar was my server! He was awesome! Very friendly & fast :) looooooove love happy hour! I recommend the wings as appetizers, half off for happy hour& they're so bomb. Definitely going to be back here with my ladies again soon!

Came in on a Friday night and was sat down at the bar by one of the waitress. 10 min later manager comes and ask us to move Bcuz there were people who have been waiting longer for a table and had not yet been seated...how the hell is that my fault?! They should really REALLY train their waiters better and give their managers some customer service education too. I would say, don't waste ur time. make the drive out to LB instead.

Where do I begin with this place.... This was my very first time coming to eat at this restaurant, Service was horrible!  I came in with 3 friends, Our order was taken, The waitress forgot to out in our order, brought us our appetizer but forgot to put in our order for the main meal, then she still managed to get upset when we called her out on it and cancel the remaining order. I do not recommend going here, then again maybe it was just our slow waitress, if you do go, I hope you get a better one.
Cesar's customer service was outstanding! By far one of the best servers I've ever had. Really cool attentive guy. Good happy hour deals too.
Great service when I went a few weeks back, my waitress was Daisy she got our order and we got it quickly!! She was awesome

I came here opening weekend and got HORRIBLE service!!!! Decided I'd give a try again, throw back some beers and watch the game.  I must say this experience was a HUGE difference. The host (a redheaded gal) got me a table within minutes of arriving. About a minute later my server, Brenda, came by with a smile on her face and a friendly personality. She told me they had happy hour all day because of football Monday. She explained the happy hour menu to me and answered all my questions. I ordered a Newcastle and a few appetizers. Brenda brought me a water while I waited for my beer. About a minute later she came with my Newcastle. She brought out all my appetizers and made sure I was satisfied with everything. She brought me a water before I could even finish it and made sure I always had a glass of beer on my table to sit back and enjoy the game.  Overall I am beyond satisfied with this experience. Food was great, drinks were always full, and plenty of tvs around the bar. If you want this kind of experience ask for Brenda!!

Looks nice, stylish, cool new decor. Came on a Wednesday night and service was incredibly slow! No refills given even for just water. They were polite but they really gotta step it up. Don't come here if you're super hungry and want to eat quick
Just visited here last week and the service was excellent, the food was delicious and the drinks delightful! I would defiantly come again to this TGI Fridays!

Taste was good BUT when I replaced my fries with the Parmesan Steak Fries... They only gave me 5 of them! Wtf?? They were good but they could have hooked me up a lil bit more... Smh... If I'm paying $18 for a plate I expect to get full... I wasnt
I really hate to leave a low review but the quality of the food is just at par with other less famous please.  The waiter service was friendly but newish. The food was just bad. Microwaved it seems.
This review is based on Melissa. I have to say she gave me a really impression of TGI Friday's on a game day.  Melissa was able to attend us with all our needs throughout our stay time.
Wow it's a tgif near my domicile. No big yip. French fries that disapoint. Nothing against the place it just bland.
Food was amazing just like our server Nathaly (red hair) she was on top of her things and took care of any misunderstandings. Food takes long but so worth it

My first visit was on Sunday, November 9, 2014 and may I say my visit was pleasant.  Although, I do have to say that the check in was a bit of a hassle, there were 6 host chatting trying to figure out what tables were open, in the mean time you had tons of people that looked confused as to where they checked in.  Wait was about 1 hour, I didn't think it be that long of a wait considering all of the tables that were open and so I was right, Cesar assisted us right away and showed us to our table, he was very warming and attentive. Next came our waitress Brianna, she was amazing, on top of her game, made me think she was a manager of some sort and if she is not,  she should be. I was able to tell the difference in service from other tables and boy was I glad to have her. Food came out quick and she checked on us pretty frequently. I hope to see both Cesar and Brianna soon. Food was great and made to order. Drinks were delicious and ambient was fun.  I brought with me a good critic- my mom :) and even she was very pleased with food and service.   Thanks again Brianna!!!

I think this might be the worst experience I've had at this place! Our server seemed as if she was brand new. Had no menu knowledge. Didn't know the difference from a French onion soup and a clam chowder. She never brought us silverware or plates for apps. Our table remained unbussed for pretty much the duration of our visit. I would understand if it were busy and she had no time but it wasn't. She was a very sweet girl very nice but sweet doesn't keep customers coming back. the trainers nor validator did their job correctly. There's about 4 girls just standing at the host stand doing nothing and a young manager standing at the end of the bar just watching the basketball game. I don't think I've seen him help anyone at all. Sorry but it's been a horrible experience. Today is 11/12/14 evening time

The greeting host/hostesses were great but when I sat at the bar I never saw a smile or felt welcome. The bar staff seems to have a sense of entitlement. The happy hour menu says domestic but the bartender said only bud, coors & some other dud. Aren't Sam Adams & the other local brews also domestic??? False advertising sucks Azzz Cheeks.
The wait is too long and the seating was not good for our party .... party of 6 got seated at a table for 5.
Waited to be seated about 5 mins. Food came fast and was good. Service was good. Only 5 mins from where I live...will go back!

Before I planned coming here I decided to check the reviews on this place and I was really surprised to see most of them were all talking so negative about this place which made me think about it twice if it was a good idea to bring my family to such a bad place and on top of that on such a special occasion which was my grandmothers birthday. I have always been a fan of FRIDAYS and in my family it has always been our to go place for birthdays so i was really excited to have one so close to me. I did not  want to fill my head with ideas without even trying it. So i thought lets wish for the best and enjoy being with the family and the convenience of it being really close.  So entering one of the girls working opened the door for us and greeted us very nicely the host greeted us also and gave us the table that was closer so my grandmother would not walk so much which was also something very nice. Our waitress came over introduced herself and was very fast with our drinks and we asked for a three for all and as soon as we said we were ready to order our food, she took the order she helped us out and another girl came over to give us our three for all with the plates.  OMG! I thought that was fast, from all the Fridays ive ever been to we pretty much have always had to wait a while for our three for all to be served and would always have to remind them about the small plates.  And as soon as we were done with the Three for all maybe not even 5 min went by when our waitress came over cleaned and took everything out of the way to make room for our food. Wow that was fast! Much faster than any Fridays before and it was 4 of us so it was great service our waitress was always asking if we needed refills at the right time, she would check on us and I think the best best part was when the waitress came over and she was cleaning up and my sister asked my grandmother "How are you enjoying your birthday today grandma?". Well at the end of our meal everybody (friday waitresses) came over and sang the happy birthday song and gave her an ice cream sundae. Apparently the waitress heard what my sister said and brought her the sundae and made everybody sing. It was wonderful and everybody had a great time we went outside and we were going to take a picture and one of the friday host came out and helped us take a picture of us all together. So I give this place 5 stars if they keep up the great work this place will get a lot of people that love fridays and will be willing to travel from wherever they are to come to this one because I can say I have been to all of the fridays in LA and honestly this one has the fastest and friendliest service.

Was walking around this plaza they made in SG decided to check it out here!  Um meal was quit good to my liking order a 6oz(Baller!!!) stake cooked mid-rare and was done to that exact point.  Sat at the bar "David" our bartender was really helpful n good to our eating needs even grab us a new stake sauce A1 baby lol  Over a i give this place 3stars bc it's nothing over the top but it wasn't bad over all.  Tip: $$$ I think though for a family restaurant

We come for happy hour in the bar area to eat and drink. They have appetizer half off on Sunday's and certain beer are discounted as well. They have all the sports games and there is a nice outside area with a fire pit. The service here is very helpful and they are great about reminding the deals and happy hour times. The jack Daniels chicken is my favorite along with the potato skin.
I was excited to have a fridays close by, when I finally went on a Friday night and got my food I find a dead fly on top of my food it was discusting and the way the supervisor handled it was awful

Worse experience ever...would give 0 stars if I could!!!! Came here to celebrate my daughters 13th Bday and it turned out the b the worst ever...it took our waiter 20+ min to get our drinks. There was 8 ppl in our party and our food came in 3's 10-15 min in between....and to top it off it took 30 min to get our bill. And when asked to speak to a manager all she could say was oh the waiters need to wait for me if they need a bill split. Like really WTF!!!! No apology for the long wait but they have the nerve to get bothered when I got an attitude. NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN rather take the drive to the long beach town center. Unprofessional manager and the host was horrible as well. TGIF get it together u will lose plenty of customers with this kind of customer service and not to mention you ruined our daughters bday tradition.

wow....all I have to say about this place is, I feel very bad for the owners and the tgif corporation for spending so much money building such a beautiful restaurant, only to have it ruined by incompetent and disgruntled staff. As an owner of a business myself, I would be bald from pulling my hair if I knew my restaurant was being run like this. From the manager Leo down to the our plus sized waitress with the glasses who cursed at us in spanish under her breath, this place is an absolute abomination to the definition of a full service restaurant.  Even getting reservations at this place was an entirely unique experience, where the female host forgot that she put me on hold twice and the male host was rude in every possible way. He said to call back an hour and a half before the reservation to make sure we would get our seats. Um...isn't that what a reservation is for? Then when we called that day someone else tells us they don't DO reservations but would make an exception for us.....umm, comprendes?  Our office still decided to do our christmas party here because I believed that maybe just the host was incompetent and the restaurant, like i said, was beautiful.  Now granted, it was the friday before christmas and tgi was extremely busy that night from other company parties, but that was no excuse to how we were treated. Of course that night our reservation was NOT honored, and we had to wait to be seated.  When we finally got seated in the patio our waitress refused to give us menus, because they weren't sure if those seats were reserved for someone else.....umm I thought you guys didn't DO reservations? The manager Leo came out to smooth over the situation and he was a nice guy, but much too timid and passive to be able to control his staff. He tried to serve us but the waitress was already disgruntled, and cursed at us under her breath.  Now an hour into our christmas dinner attempt, we didn't want to find some unpleasantries in our food (such as saliva), and decided to take our business elsewhere.  My only hope is that the owners of this location read this review and take a closer look at how this restaurant is managed. It really is a shame.

Horrible service. Arrived around 9:30pm and it is currently 10:38pm and no food yet! Appetizers came out but the waitress did not bring utensils, napkins or extra plates. I had to take it upon myself to get up and walk to the bar to get my own napkins. That's unacceptable and the place isn't even crowded, been here before on a much busier day and the service wasn't this bad. Definitely will not consider coming here again.

the waitress hardly came, my wings were pink in the middle and after one bite i stopped , got a bit disgusted. but that's the least of it, the table were we sat at was a bit uncomfortable due to there being other employees I'm guessing off the clock on the other side of the tables, and i could hear them just talk smack about everyone and then i saw some waitress coming over to there table and started silently arguing with the group "off the clock employees" it was all really an uncomfortable time , never have i been somewhere where the employess just talk shit to each other and bout there other team members  whilst around ppl dining in the restaurant . smh.
Save your money & go eat at In-n-Out. The food they served us was way different than as pictured in the menu. Huge disappointment.

This place has horrible service. Not only did I wait almost an hour to get a waiter to acknowledge us but we waited an additional hour to get served cold food.  NEVER EVER AM I GOING THERE AGAIN!!!  THEY DONT EVEN DESERVE ONE STAR!!

Did some shopping at the new shopping center so I decided to stop by with my family to get some dinner before heading out for a movie, first bad start is since we sat in one of the tables at the bar area none of the servers wanted to take our table, finally we waved down a young girl who took our order and I don't know if they were just super busy in the kitchen or maybe they don't have enough employees to maintain they're tables, while waiting for our food servers continuously stopped by with random plates, these guys need to learn they're table numbers, but maybe it's not their fault maybe they're manager doesn't know how to schedule his employees nor train them. South Gate, you did good by bringing TGI Fridays in my hood!

I'm a huge fan of Friday's and have visited various location across LA and the San Fernando Valley, they all are set up a little different but have the same concept, deals and service overall except this location. Usual when you go to any Fridays or chain restaurant for that matter, there is self sitting at the bar / bar booths and area. My brother, best friend, a few friends and myself proceeded to seat in the bar area booths. A hostesses came up to us and told us that they have to seat is which is fine but she said it in a condescending and rude was, very rude and kept giving my friends and myself dirty looks. We just ignored her, our waitress was the best person in the building, loved her.  As I previously mentioned, all the locations are one in the same, I pressed my usual Nachos without meat and just asked for extra quest inside. Why did my nachos come out I have never seen them before , half portions with some red stuff that looked like cayenne pepper sprinkled on them, just sad and soggy. I was so over the experience. My friend called manager out. He tried to low-key debate with us but ended up refunding me for those wannabe nachos.  I will not return to this location :(.

Kudos to our wonderful waitress MACY,  she was attentive and assured we were taken care of!  In addition Maria who's wasn't even our waitress would stop by  just to make sure we had all we needed!   This lovely ladies deserve 5 stars for their exceptional customer service , which is a rarity this day

If I could leave zero stars I would. My chicken had the ever appealing taste of burned charcoal, my friends drink tasted like flat sprite and it was ridiculously overpriced. I asked for a beer which took more than 10mins to receive and I didn't get any water in the mean time. We paid our tab and checked out, no tip deserved. We accidentally left one of our iPhone's there and when I went back to get it our waitress gave it back and rudely reminded me that we didn't tip her while brushing me off. It was completely unnecessary. You didn't get a tip because you were rude ALYSSA. No other reason than that.

This place is cool. Based on the area we live in, you're bound to come across some characters. Unfortunately, another party took our fries which is why it took forever for us to receive them. But the manager (John) came over and apologized to us in the nicest way possible and took it off the tab for us. It's just $1.50 for the fries (awesome happy hour), but it was the apology that I appreciated most of all. Thanks for being cool y'all.

I love TGIFRIDAYS. The waitresses have always been nice n courteous and food comes in a timely manner. The bar tho, that's a different story. I was in the bar ones on a Friday night n the bartender ( which was a chick by the way) was a little rude n unfriendly . Idk if it was bcus ir was Friday n she was stuck working but nonetheless, do ur job n practice good customer service. Over all I give it 4 stars :)

So me and my girlfriend came here on a Saturday night around 11:30 pm. We came in for the 10 bucks endless apps. deal we were seated and ordered once we received our food the waitress said "We stop serving food at 12" so we were mad because why would you seat us knowing you stop serving food at 12?! Endless apps so we wanted grub all we can eat which we couldn't do. Food was nice and hot though. About a week later we went in again around 6 pm. Kind of crowded ordered the same thing and our food was cold like they cooked it and had it sitting up didn't really enjoy it but the service was good. So we prolly won't be coming to this location again.

Met my sister and nephew here for lunch. My sister raved about how she enjoyed the  $12 app option at the Compton TGIF, so we opted for that.  First off,  the service was slow. It wasn't that crowded,  so couldn't understand why.  But, our hostess was nice and accommodating.  As far as the food,  meh! I first ordered the pot stickers. They were not cooked properly. There wasn't a crisp to them.  Then I got some boneless wings (aka chicken nuggets) with I think was a bourbon sauce. But I wanted the miso sauce, but they didn't have it. Anyway, my wings tasted like chicken nuggets with teriyaki sauce. Alright I guess. My son and sister ordered the loaded potato skins.  Both couldn't eat them because they were too greasy! After paying my tab, I wish I'd just took my money and went to In N Out or Chipotle.  I would have paid less and been satisfied.

I had dinner at this location and had less than good.service for a SECOND time   I ordered an appetizer and i had to flag down a waitress to see if she could find my waitress to take my order (appetizer had been long gone). I flagged down a different waitress bcuz the other one never came back nor did my waitress. Finally my waitress comes w an excuse and lets me.know my food is coming. My daughters food arrives and she is about two bites away from finishing her dinner when i flag down a waitress yo inquire about my food. My waitress finally comes around and tells me she doesnt know why my order is taking so.long. finally i get my food and begin eating...i want to order a sangria but by the time my waitress came   chk i was almost done. Sad to give it 3 stars but like i said, its the 2nd time this happens at the same location.

WOW. walked in this place after a bum night, maybe like 12:35, said the kitchen was closed... mehhhh, we'll have a drink anyway. Hostess told us to go ahead and sit at the bar, I asked for a table. Anyyyyyyyway got our table sat there for like 15-17 min not  ONE PERSON asked to take our order. It wasnt even that busy....excused ourselves and left!! As we're walking out a server says, "sorry i wasnt working fast enough" WTF?? ughh never again!

I came in around 11:00PM with my boyfriend. Ordered our food and drinks. The service was absolutely horrible that night. Took way to long to get our drinks. It took them about 20-25 minutes to get me a glass of water. Once we finished our dinner we waited for the waiter to show up; when the waiter finally showed up we asked for the check and it took him about an hour to get us the check.  It's not always that bad but they definitely always take forever to come take food orders.

So heres the thing. I walk into Fridays hoping to enjoy a refreshing glass of apple juice only to find out I'm paying for a cup of ice with two shots of juice. Given i did enjoy the endless appetizers my experience was ruined when i was told that i would not be getting another serving of juice. For something that grows on trees they sure are stingy. Overall ok service horrible serving size for some apple juice extremely disappointed.

I'm a big fan of TGIF, but my wife and myself were seated in the bar area for 15 mins before even greeted by a server that was off the clock. He was great. Thanks guy. It's now been 20 mins and we are yet to meet our server.

2nd time coming in. First time was 3 months ago and the waitresses stood around talking and service was mud.  This time around ALOT better. Waitress was very attentive, good food, strong drinks. If they keep up this current trend it will def be my go to dinner spot.
Just wanted to know how many people eat romain hearts in they mix green salads because I was told people like it like that

Came for a birthday dinner for my friend's boyfriend and our waitress quickly provided us with a glass of water as soon as we sat down. Our orders came quite fast and she made separate receipts for our group which was something that I appreciated.  They did sing the shortest happy birthday song to my friend's boyfriend and we thought that it was funny! This location was not packed and it was a good choice for a late dinner since not many places were open.
Terrible customer service !! We called to server & straight look at us & turn around & ignore us !! For sure never coming to this place again

Let's just say it's a hit and miss with this location; sometimes you'll get excellent service and other times you're going to sit there and want to walk out. I've experience both. Sometimes you'll walk right in and get seated right away and other times you'll wait a good 20-30 minutes. Sitting at the bar is good, when you can find an empty spot. Some of the bartenders are really nice and friendly, others not so much. Overall it's a good late night spot, with the same food you'll find at any other TGIF.

The outside patio is beautiful to sit at at nighttime. There's a fire centerpiece, and heating fire lamps next to each table. I prefer to sit outside, there's a flat screen and it's way less raunchy and loud than the inside. There's usually a wait to sit outside but nothing crazy, we came with a party of 4 on a Saturday night & the wait was 10 minutes. The buffalo boneless wings are very very good, and the $1.50 basket of happy hour fries are unbeatable when served hot. The $1.50 happy hour hamburger sliders are super cute and pretty good. The $6 happy hour drinks are very strong in my taste, the ultimate Long Island iced tea was way strong compared to say, lazy dog café Long Island iced tea, but if you're looking for a buzz this will get you going. The (I forget the name) with Malibu, sour powder, Sprite, kiwi, and pineapple juice is quite small for $7.50, so because of that I probably wouldn't order again. The service is decent, but there are clusters of employees everywhere talking, laughing, and swearing up a storm, loudly. It's fine to have fun at work, but I didn't enjoy the cluster of employees in uniform outside on the patio sitting next to us being extremely loud and swearing. It's just really unprofessional and nobody wants to see/hear that.

Food and service was horrible both times I have gone.   The waitress forgot about us and we had to ask another waitress where she was at one point.  They food is always overcooked and if you are getting dessert, it taste like they just took it out the freezer, put it on the microwave and served it.

Let's start off with floor was greasy towards restrooms makes it dangerous for kids or women in heels.   Ordered medium/well sirloin steak was a bit undercooked and when we let waitress know she was kind enough to take it back to the kitchen but what I didn't like is that they brought the same piece  back and not a new one. Waitress was polite and everything was okay until the end where she forgot about us didn't ask if we wanted anything else no desert and had to ask someone else for the bill.  When we paid we received incorrect change back left no tip left unsatisfied

This place has been quite awesome in facilitating our big groups. Layout perfectly suits the patio area with the bonfire pits.  Another Fantastic aspect: Community! they were very welcoming and helpful in our fundraising event we held here for the Leland Weaver Library. The staff and manager were not only helpful but personal contributors to our fund. Now the kids will continue to have free events and support at the Library!!!!

On her first day of training, our waitress, Desiree, did a great job at remembering our variety of drinks and food, gave us great recommendations, and has an outstanding personality... very amiable and attentive.

Visited this location last night and it exceeded my expectations. I was hesitant at their 2 and a half stars but we definitely experienced 5 star quality service. Maybe it was our waitress Desiree that made it the experience enjoyable. Within seconds of being seated she greeted us and got us started with drinks. She was very attentive, friendly, and interactive with us. We later found out she was in training. What? I would have never known she did her job like she's been working there for a while. Our drinks and food came correct, she checked in with us very 5 to 10 minutes making sure we were taken care off, and most importantly she seemed like she was enjoying her job. We also met Doris who was training her, she too checked in with us a couple times to oversee and ask how Desiree was doing. I would definitely return to this location again. Highly due to the overall service provided to us by the staff. Two dumbs up for Desiree, keep up the exceptional work.
Terrible service. We waited for 20 minutes. It was empty in there and the waitresses kept passing and passing and would completely ignore us.

Good GOD the food is disgusting.  My steak had a big piece of gristle running through it so I had to eat around it, which meant I really didn't get much of a steak.  I also had to drown my steak in A1 sauce to cover up the lousy taste.  My friends salad was the total opposite of what the server said it would be. The drinks (just an iced tea) was horrible.  Our server was too busy with another table, so we had to flag down someone else who told us "But the tea is fresh brewed."  Uh....it still tastes horrible.  Our server rarely checked on us.  There was no one there, which baffles me.  I left there hungry and actually ended up grabbing a Subway sandwich on the way home.  I've been to other TGIF's and they were excellent and the service was great!  I have NO idea what is going on with this one.  Never again!

Front desk customer service was so horrible that our party ended up leaving the restaurant. I've eaten here plenty of times and the food is always great with mediocre service. But this time takes the cake. I went in last Friday and stood at the front while some girl chatted on the phone and a host and hostess completely ignored me and everyone else who was waiting. A couple other people came in after me and had to bug the male host to get some attention and ask how long the wait was. I seemed to annoy the host when I asked if he could seat is and he told us we would just have to wait like everyone else. I had to ask him how long the wait was and if there was a list. There were about four people at the desk who didn't greet anyone or seem to want to seat anyone. I understand Friday's are busy at tgi Fridays but it seems you have to beg to pay for dinner. At this point I called chilis and there was no wait. I guess it doesn't matter that they lost me and my friends' service since they can afford a team of hosts to do nothing.

Our server took forever to bring us our drinks! We waited like at least 20 minutes until we got fed up and went to get our own drinks from the bar and our server happen to be there just talking in no hurry to attends us I will never return to this location ever again! Horrible slow service

I'd figure we give fridays a try again we usually go to chillis. 1st of We didn't wait long walked in and got seated right away, the manager approached us he was very nice. We order from the appetizer menu where you choose from 3-5 different appetizers so we chose; wings, potato skins, mozzarella sticks and pretzels. My son (3 yrs old) asked for a pepperoni pizza. Everything was going great waitress was friendly and nice. Until our food came out well 1st they gave my son a cheese pizza when we asked for pepperoni (I didn't say anything) he would eat it anyway. Our appetizers come out there was no wings on our plate we give it a few minutes nothing,So we flag our waitress down you could tell she forgot about the wings just how she forgot that I said pepperoni pizza. We get our wings and we ask for ranch 5 minutes later and no ranch. I really wanted to give TGIF another chance but I guess not.

I frequent this place weekly, don't go there on a busy day or night.  They have an extremely difficult time accomodating folks when the pressure is on. We walked into the establishment during Happy hour & we saw visible seating & showed it to the ladies as we placed our names on the list. They-ladies quickly informed us that we had to be wait-listed for the bar section? Yet it was visible with empty seats.  Some of the other seats outside the bar section was empty but not cleaned.  After we were called to be placed, we were seated outside the bar area. How crazy is that? The females putting you on the waitlist don't even communicate regarding placements, why are we being seated outside our request? Then our waitress is scheduled everywhere in the establishment and you have to track them down to get your basic needs met.  Our waitress was fabulous after we were seated but the organization sucks big time. This place can be so much better if communication was collaborative from the door entry....... Plus, scheduling waitress all over the place provides poor waitress service.....

Its ok. The food is still horrible (like any Fridays) but at least its affordable. Same at the bar, not too overpriced. The service was really good too, although I do miss the days where the Fridays waiters had more flare lol. I'd come back just for happy hour or late night appetizers.

Service was really slow in the beginning but definitely picked up after a bit. Waiter was really friendly, and more importantly, patient with us. Very enthusiastic and fun to talk to. Probably the highlight of our visit there Everything on their menu seemed so irresistible, but we settled for 2 person $20 special since it was such a great deal. You get a select few appetizers to choose from along with their list of entrees, which isn't half bad. Not to mention your choice of dessert at the end. The prime steak pasta was ok and the steak was actually really tender. Not chewy at all. I had my first red velvet cake here and it was delicious :-) They're open late so its a great place to grab a bite after a night of shopping at the nearby 24-hour Walmart

Had dinner with family last night after a long drive that day. The service was just okay. We ordered drinks and they take so long to make them. My family ordered a mojito and two Mai tai's that tasted like just a sugar rush. I ordered a tiramisu martini that was definitely not what it looks like in the picture or like the last time I was there. Every time I chi back to that place the drinks are less full but you get charged the same price. I asked the waiter to make sure the next martini was not a half martini and when he brought it I just laughed a little. The presentation of it was ugly and again it was pretty low in the actual martini. Although I was told that "that's how a martini is" I've been there previously and they did not look like last night. Very disappointed but especially disappointed that they don't put the clients first.

I went to this restaurant for the special occasion, and this was my very first visit to TGI Friday's. The dish I order was the baby back ribs dish with side of vegetables. This baby back ribs was more spicier than the ribs in BJ's. I'm looking forward to visit this restaurant again.

Lunch time: Fast/efficient service (only about five tables or so were taken)  Dinner time: Horrible service! Waited for our food for an hour, we decided to leave because it was taking way too long. The only good thing about this place are the drinks. Other than that, please do not visit this place for dinner. The servers/runners aren't quick enough. It doesn't seem like the customers are their first priority.

I have been here two times. The first time I came with a big group of people and we sat outside. It took a while to receive our food, we noticed that it was just sitting on the counter and once we received our food it was cold. So we returned it. The manager gave us a discount which was nice but no excuse for the cold food. The second time my bf and I got the 2 for 20$ deal I ordered the shrimp pasta with chicken. It was the most nasty pasta I have ordered ever. The chicken had no flavor it tasted like tap water. I was so disappointed. I will not be returning again

Came in at 11/17/15 around 530pm . i was seated and waited 10 minutes for a server to come by . The manager at that time was John and happened to come by our table and ask how we were doing so we let him know we were waiting 10 minutes. He took our drink order and apologized. We order and appetizer and a rack of ribs. The ribs came first and then the appetizer. The ribs had less than a handful of fries so i was upset at the time and to top it off we had no silverware  i am calling upper management tomorrow

3rd time i go there and the last.  Ordered the steak and lobster.   Made my order very simple and the plate came with the wrong side dishes than after they corrected my order and bring me what i ordered, the food was cold.  I didn't even finish it.  I just left.  I didn't bother speaking with the manager because you can't fix stupid.  3 times is just a waste of my time and money.

It was my first time going to Tgi Fridays 2 weeks ago and I actually really enjoyed it. The unlimited appetizers was what I had gotten with my boyfriend. It was nice to have a small variety of wings, flatbread, mozzarella sticks, and potato wedges for only $20. Don't let the word appetizers fool you, it actually makes you really full while having the luxury of eating different meals. Nice place too :)

Friday's on a Friday  Black Friday at that It's great enjoyed happy hour and might be the luck of the draw but some nice company to bring in Saturday. The bartenders did me right and service was on point if not slightly sluggish. The atmosphere is what did It. A couple of beautiful women to lighten the mood

I've visited this particular restaurant twice. I don't live in the area so i had never been to a TGI Fridays before.  The first time i was with a girlfriend and my 2 year old, it was a weekday so I was surprised when i walked in the hostess said the wait time was 30min.  I thought maybe there was a game on perhaps. well, there was plenty of empty tables outside so i asked the hostess if we can be seated outside instead she said the wait time would be the same. I didn't get that.  After waiting for 15 min I went back to the hostess stand and asked why i had to wait if there were about 5 tables in the patio that seemed avaliable. She then made a face and said "ill be right with you"  i waited another 10 minutes and went back to the hostess stand and asked why was I waiting so long if no one was being seated outside. she then said "we're short on staff so we only have one waitress outside."   Did that mean i was suppose to expect bad service? or feel bad for them? it was very unprofessional and rude. She seated me with a total attitude and didn't even offer me a kids menu or high chair. The waitress however was really nice and apologized for not receiving a kids menu.  So why did I return for a second time?  I thought I'd give it another shot since the food was not bad it was just the service. Well, to say the least the second time was just as bad. The hostess was rude, the waitress never offered refills or boxes. Seems like they need some training on customer service and possibly new jobs.

The manager of the night shift on Thursday night 12/3/15 is the worse! His server messed up our orders all night   He refused to take responsibility after his server accepted the bad service. We all talked to him but denied any discount for our bill. Never going back to this location. Stay away!

This must be the worst TGIF I have ever been to. The waitress, Donna, was not attentive and rarely checked up to see if we were doing fine. I had to ask one of the bussers to give me a refill. The food was okay. For some reason the food here at this TGIF did not taste as fresh as others.  I asked for a  Strawberry Passion Fruit Tea. I told Donna about the situation and asked her to bring the Manager. The  Manager's name was John. He didn't give me a refill nor did he do anything about the situation. All he said was that just because its tea you have to fill it up with ice. When have we heard of this? Never have I gone to a restaurant and my cup is almost full with ice.  I can not believe this.  I truly do not recommend this place to any one around the area. This was the second time I tried this place. First time was a disaster as well. My girlfriend and I encountered a fly in our drink and once again nothing was done about it and they still charged us for it. I'm going to pay my bill now, and I will never be back to this place.
Gave them the benefit of the doubt and only came for convenience! Service sucks! Took our server 7 minutes to even come to our table!! WTH

Down the street from my house I can even walk. Service was good, food was good can't comain with happy hour. It's convienent for me and my Friends because we can walk down the street enjoy drinks and food at an affordable Price and best of all neither of us have to drive.

I was just in with my friend on 12/4/2015.  I have never experienced such service in a restaurant before. It started off good...then it was just horrible. Our server came, took our drink order, brought the drinks, took our food order and it was a good while before he checked on us again. Another server brought our food, which was just ok. I get that you see people you know at your work place and greet them, but to actually sit down and neglect your tables just to hang out when you're supposed to be working is not ok. Never again will I come to this location.

Zero stars. first off worst costumer service ever, they are so slow and some times is even empty then the bar omg they are slow as ... talking with costumers without doing their job and they don't even ask you if you want something to drink,they act rude if you ask for service,are you serious? If you don't like you job quit.

The beer is great but the service is the worst waitress never came by to ask if anything was ok came in with a huge appetite ordered appetizer to start and she never came back to check if was ready to order my buddy had to ask another waitress for assistance not cool he ordered and I refuse to eat here. Gonna finish my beer pay my tab and off to WINGHOUSE Never again will I come back

We've gone to other TGI Fridays but this was by far the worst. There where one too many hostess standing around with a lot of open tables. The waitress wasn't very attentive and our food wasn't good. The potatoes skins didn't seem like they were cooked fully because the cheese was not melted. The rib eye seemed like it was an old piece of meat. Overall dissatisfied. Do not go to this one.

I'm not one to complain but EVERY visit here is always the worst. Not sure if it is management or the workers not being well organized but they take forever to help you. We had to ask for WATER like 3 times when they didn't bring it to us and we were at the bar top. My friend was waiting for almost an hour for her burger sliders that never came after she asked for them about three times. The person who was helping us then told her why she was acting bothered as if she didn't have a reason. We had to talk to the manager and we left because we didn't even feel comfortable there any longer. I will not be coming back and neither our friends whom came with us that night. I tried giving this place a few tries but it is always something.

Been here numerous times and was always happy, until today! My husband and I liked to come here on weekends, the food and drinks are reasonable specially when it's Happy hour you can't go unhappy.  Usually we sit right away at the bar but today our son joined us so we had to wait for a table. Immediately the manager apologized and was able to seat us within 5 min after I spoke with him.  Our waitress, Nancy, was nice. Our first round of drinks came within 5 min of ordering as well as our appetizers within 10 min. My friends will definitely not join us here if there's even a next time. Clearly management has changed.

AVOID THE SOUTH GATE TGI FRIDAYS, DRIVE THE EXTRA FEW MILES TO A DIFFERENT ONE!  If I could give zero stars I would. Been here twice so far, service was good, but they need a waiting area, both times my kids and i just stood by the hostess, people kept bumping into us, a waitress accidentally knocked my daughter down (shes 3), it was super packed, there was more people standing by the entrance and outside, i seen empty dirty tables, this last time i was so annoyed, as i was about to just walk out, they called us to sit down,  and the waitress apologized, and was super nice.

DO NOT COME HERE!!!! Horrible service!!! It was a late Sunday night, the restaurant was EMPTY and everything took FOREVER!!! We asked our waiter for refills and he never brought them out to us. Sucks ! Fries were cold we sent them back and not even two minutes later they sent basically same batch with less fries and seemes as tho they place on high in microwave . Food ok, but the service was horrible. First they asked us about 10times how many ppl in our party which I found funny lol but that wasn't the issue. Not worth the money I spent. Wouldn't visit again

I would never go here again..we had a party of 6 we were told it would be a 30 minute wait which took 45 minutes. The food was terrible nothing compare to TGI in long beach.

I should  have looked at the reviews. The cook is awful!  They have no idea what  a med-rare steak is that  was my 1st experience with this restaurant 2 weekends ago. That cook needs to get fired! I would been better off at rallys. Find another tgif and save yourself the aggravation.
This place sucks bad service  bad food hostesses  bad Manager didn't even came to ask how was service worse experience   Cerritos TGIF is the best !!!

Overall, we did notice the slow service towards the end of our stay especially since our waitress went home but we were there for almost 5 hours lol so we didn't care at all.  But our waitress was awesome and she made our experience that much better!!  What was truly amazing was when it was time to pay the bill, she was able to split our bills to per couple (we had 12 people all together)!!  I'd come back again for the ambient and the endless apps lol especially for happy hours! On a side note:  they do offer tablets at your table so you can view the menu (I thought it was weird that you can't order food or drinks on the tablet...isn't this why you have it in the first place???)  and also you can request service on the tablet but it doesn't work.  We pressed it and it just kept blinking without anyone ever stopping by.  Just for fun we left it blinking under our table Har har har :P  oh and for $1.99 you can play games on it lol (for everyone who haven't converted to smart phones yet)
